feed.title: SAP Community - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Extensibility
feed.subtitle: SAP S/4HANA Cloud Extensibility Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: How to Create Data via BOI from Custom SAPUI5 App in S/4HANA Public Cloud?
entry.content:
Hello experts,

I‚Äôm working on an SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud scenario where I need to create new data (entity instances) from a custom SAPUI5 application.
The app is already deployed as a tile in the Fiori Launchpad and is consuming an OData service that I exposed through ABAP Development Tools (ADT) in Eclipse. This OData service is based on a custom CDS view.

Now, I want to perform create operations ‚Äî for example, creating a Production Order Confirmation.
I found the following Business Object Interface (BOI) on the SAP API Business Hub:
üëâ I_PRODUCTIONORDCONFIRMATIONTP

However, I‚Äôm not sure about the best practice for implementing this BOI interface in the Public Cloud environment:

  • Should I create a custom RAP (RESTful ABAP Programming Model) behavior definition that consumes the BOI interface?

  • Or is there another recommended integration pattern for invoking BOIs from a custom application?

  • How can I trigger the BOI create operation from my custom UI5 app (which currently consumes only my custom CDS service)?

I‚Äôd appreciate any guidance, examples, or references on how to correctly implement a BOI-based data creation scenario in S/4HANA Public Cloud.

Thank you in advance!
Tadeas

entry.title: RAP event - Additional save > Raise Event > INSERT generates shortdump
entry.content:
Whenever the user calls an OData service, I need to save the data to a table and immediately trigger additional actions. In my case, the preparing and printing of a custom form based on the saved data. In the current setup this generates a shortdump.

To get this to work, I'm using the "with additional save" option within the behavior definition. This provides me with the 'save_modified' method to handle my additional save. If I simply perform an INSERT there, the record is inserted into the database without issue.

However, to properly decouple the process, I raise an entity event 'created', which is defined in the behavior definition.

METHOD save_modified.
    data lt_header type table for event zlp_os_i_del_hdr\\Header~created.
    lt_header = corresponding #( create-header ).
    RAISE ENTITY EVENT ZLP_OS_I_DEL_Hdr\\Header~created from lt_header.
ENDMETHOD.

This event is handled by a separate class.

METHODS:
  consume_created FOR ENTITY EVENT created_instances FOR Header~created.

method consume_created.
  " INSERT here results in shortdump

  loop at created_instances into data(ls_created).
    zlp_os_cl_delivery=>print_label( ls_created-HeaderGuid ).
  endloop.
endmethod.

Normally, in this method, the label is prepared and placed in a print queue. That last step is done using a standard SAP class, which eventually performs an INSERT.

cl_print_queue_utils=>create_queue_item_by_data(
  iv_qname            = lv_printer
  iv_print_data       = lv_pdf
  iv_name_of_main_doc = |Label date/time|
  iv_number_of_copies = 1
).

In case I perform my INSERT there, the system dumps. 

Execution takes place in a transactional context: A "PHASE <modify>" call is
active with "ZLP_OS_BROKER_DELIVERY". The current statement "INSERT <dbtab>" is therefore forbidden.

I was under the impression that the additional save would prevent this from happening. But it seems the event creates a new RAP phase, in which I still can't INSERT anything.

Am I going about this the wrong way? Thanks in advance for the help üôÇ

---

Apologies for the Label, the 'Labels' box only accepts the proposed 'GenAI Assisted Content' although this has nothing to do with the subject ü§î won't let me post without labels, so it is what it is.

entry.title: Translation for Custom Field (based on CBO) not reflecting in F4 Help in Italian
entry.content:
SAP S/4HANA Cloud

Hi Experts,

I created a Custom Business Object (CBO) in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud and maintained translations for its fields, including Italian. Then I created a Custom Field based on this CBO and added it to the Manage Product Master Data app via UI Adaptation.

Everything looks fine when logging in English. But when the user logs in Italian, the F4 value help still appears in English ‚Äî even though the translations are maintained in the CBO and Custom Field.

Expected: F4 dropdown values should appear in Italian when logging in Italian
Actual: F4 dropdown values remain in English

Attaching screenshot for reference.

Custom field created in association to CBO and maintained language as well.

Irrespective of logon langauge, F4 HELP is coming in english.

Has anyone else faced this issue? Is there any configuration, cache refresh, or workaround to enable translated F4 values? Is this a known limitation with CBO-based Value Help in Public Cloud?

Any guidance is highly appreciated.

Regards,

Jagadhatri

ABAP Extensibility SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Extensibility

entry.title: Adobe Form: Subform in every page
entry.content:
Hello,

I'm working with Livecycle for a custom delivery note form in S/4HANA Public Cloud.

I'm trying to have a subform in the content form repeat at the top of every page, I cannot use the master form for this purpose as the subform in question has some delivery data not available in the master datasource. I had come to a solution by setting the header subform as overflow leader in all the other subform, however, the limitation is that there is a table with item details that can grow very large, the first time it overflows the header subform appears on top of the second page, but if it overflows again in a third page the header is not displayed.

The header subform is positioned, while the rest of the document is flowed, so trying to place the header at the top of page mst2 (which I have to do by editing the xml as the master pages are not referenceable via the pagination settings UI) results in the header being printed after the rest of the content.

Is there some setting that I'm missing? Would the pagination setting "Place on top of page..." work if the whole form was positioned?

Alternatively, I've tried to make a new master with the delivery note datasource, but that results in an error when printing a real delivery note, is there any way I can bring delivery note data fields into the master?

Thanks.

entry.title: Custom Adobe Form How to Print 7 Outputs with Different Copy Labels in SAP S/4 HANA Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I am working on SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, and I have a requirement in a custom Adobe Form for SD invoices. The business needs to print 7 copies of the same invoice form.

In the Master Form Header of each copy, we must display a specific label :-

1) Copy 1 :- Original for Recipient

2) Copy 2 :- Duplicate for Transporter

3) Copy 3 :- Triplicate for Supplier

4) Copy 4 To 7 :- Extra Copy

Has anyone implemented multiple 7 output prints for a Custom Adobe Form in S/4HANA Public Cloud?
Any guidance or best practices on how to achieve this requirement would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you,

entry.title: Issue with CDS Join for SD & FI Documents for Custom IRN RAP Application
entry.content:
Hello Expert,

I am working on a custom RAP based Fiori Elements Application for IRN and E-Way Bill Generation. Currently, we generate the IRN using the SD Document Type based on the CDS view I_BillingDocumentBasic.

As per the new requirement, we also need to include FI Documents, so we are using the CDS view I_JournalEntryItem. Our objective is to retrieve DG and DR documents using a UNION ALL, but we are facing an issue where some required fields are not appearing. I have attached a Code of the CDS view which we have  Developed.

Could anyone guide us on what might be causing the join issue or how we can achieve this requirement in our custom IRN application?

We have created two CDS views one is a join of the FI and SD document CDS views, and the another is the Backend CDS view used for IRN Generation where we fetch the Document Type.

Please find the attached First CDS view which has Join logic for both the SD and FI Document CDS views.

@AbapCatalog.viewEnhancementCategory: [#NONE]
@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #NOT_REQUIRED
@EndUserText.label: 'Billing and FICO Document Type Join'
@Metadata.ignorePropagatedAnnotations: true
define view entity ZI_INV_FI_DOC_JOIN
  as select from I_BillingDocumentBasic     as VBRK

    inner join   I_BillingDocumentItemBasic as VBRP on VBRK.BillingDocument = VBRP.BillingDocument
{
  key VBRK.BillingDocument         as BillingDocument,
  key VBRP.BillingDocumentItem     as BillingDocumentItem,
      VBRK.CompanyCode             as CompanyCode,
      VBRK.BillingDocumentType     as BillingDocumentType,
      VBRK.AccountingExchangeRate  as AccountingExchangeRate,
      VBRK.DocumentReferenceID     as DocumentReferenceID,
      VBRK.BillingDocumentDate     as BillingDocumentDate,
      VBRK.CreationDate            as CreationDate,
      VBRK.PayerParty              as Customer,
      @Semantics.amount.currencyCode: 'TransactionCurrency'
      VBRK.TotalNetAmount          as TotalNetAmount,
      VBRK.TransactionCurrency     as TransactionCurrency,
      VBRP.Plant                   as Plant,
      VBRP.ReferenceSDDocument     as ReferenceSDDocument,
      VBRP.ReferenceSDDocumentItem as ReferenceSDDocumentItem,
      VBRP.Material                as Material,
      @Semantics.quantity.unitOfMeasure: 'BillingQuantityUnit'
      VBRP.BillingQuantity         as BillingQuantity,
      VBRP.BillingQuantityUnit     as BillingQuantityUnit,
      VBRP.BaseUnit                as BaseUnit,
      @Semantics.amount.currencyCode: 'TransactionCurrency'
      VBRP.NetAmount               as NetAmount
}
union all select from I_JournalEntry     as BKPF
  inner join          I_JournalEntryItem as ACDOCA on BKPF.AccountingDocument = ACDOCA.AccountingDocument
{
  key BKPF.AccountingDocument                             as BillingDocument,
  key cast(ACDOCA.AccountingDocumentItem as abap.char(6)) as BillingDocumentItem,
      BKPF.CompanyCode                                    as CompanyCode,
      BKPF.AccountingDocumentType                         as BillingDocumentType,
      BKPF.ExchangeRate                                   as AccountingExchangeRate,
      BKPF.DocumentReferenceID                            as DocumentReferenceID,
      BKPF. PostingDate                                   as BillingDocumentDate,
      ACDOCA.CreationDate                                 as CreationDate,
      ACDOCA.Customer                                     as Customer,
      ACDOCA.AmountInTransactionCurrency                  as TotalNetAmount,
      ACDOCA.TransactionCurrency                          as TransactionCurrency,
      ACDOCA.Plant                                        as Plant,
      BKPF.DocumentReferenceID                            as ReferenceSDDocument,
      ACDOCA.SourceReferenceDocumentItem                  as ReferenceSDDocumentItem,
      ACDOCA.Product                                      as Material,
      ACDOCA.Quantity                                     as BillingQuantity,
      ACDOCA.ReferenceQuantityUnit                        as BillingQuantityUnit,
      ACDOCA.BaseUnit                                     as BaseUnit,
      ACDOCA.AmountInTransactionCurrency                  as NetAmount
}

 

Here is the another CDS view where we are using this CDS view in the background for fetching the Document Type of SD & FI.

 

@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #NOT_REQUIRED
@EndUserText.label: 'view entity to pick Invoice number'
@Metadata.ignorePropagatedAnnotations: true
define root view entity ZBR_INV_EDOC_PICK
       with parameters
       iv_fkdat : abap.dats
  as select from    ZI_INV_FI_DOC_JOIN            as _VBRK_BKPF

    left outer join I_ProductText                 as MAKT      on MAKT.Product = _VBRK_BKPF.Material
    left outer join I_Plant                       as t001w     on t001w.Plant = _VBRK_BKPF.Plant
    inner join      I_Customer                    as KNA1      on KNA1.Customer = _VBRK_BKPF.Customer
  
    inner join      ZR_EDOC_TYPE                  as EIDOCTYPE on  EIDOCTYPE.CompanyCode = _VBRK_BKPF.CompanyCode
                                                               and EIDOCTYPE.BillingType = _VBRK_BKPF.BillingDocumentType
  
    inner join      I_ProductPlantBasic           as marc      on  marc.Product = _VBRK_BKPF.Material
                                                               and marc.Plant   = _VBRK_BKPF.Plant
    inner join      I_CompanyCode                 as t001      on t001.CompanyCode = _VBRK_BKPF.CompanyCode
    left outer join I_IN_PlantBusinessPlaceDetail as PBplace   on  PBplace.Plant       = _VBRK_BKPF.Plant
                                                               and PBplace.CompanyCode = _VBRK_BKPF.CompanyCode
    left outer join I_IN_BusinessPlaceTaxDetail   as BBRANCH   on  BBRANCH.CompanyCode   = _VBRK_BKPF.CompanyCode
                                                               and BBRANCH.BusinessPlace = PBplace.BusinessPlace

  association [0..1] to I_Currency      as _TransactionCurrency on $projection.TransactionCurrency = _TransactionCurrency.Currency
  association [0..1] to I_UnitOfMeasure as _BillingQuantityUnit on $projection.BillingQuantityUnit = _BillingQuantityUnit.UnitOfMeasure
{
  key  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingDocument,
  key  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingDocumentItem,
       _VBRK_BKPF.CompanyCode,
       _VBRK_BKPF.BillingDocumentType,
       _VBRK_BKPF.AccountingExchangeRate,
       _VBRK_BKPF.DocumentReferenceID,
       _VBRK_BKPF.BillingDocumentDate,
       _VBRK_BKPF.CreationDate,
       @Semantics.amount.currencyCode: 'TransactionCurrency'
       _VBRK_BKPF.TotalNetAmount,
       @ObjectModel.foreignKey.association: '_TransactionCurrency'
       _VBRK_BKPF.TransactionCurrency,
       _VBRK_BKPF.Plant,
       _VBRK_BKPF.ReferenceSDDocument,
       _VBRK_BKPF.ReferenceSDDocumentItem,
       _VBRK_BKPF.Material,
       PBplace.BusinessPlace,
       MAKT.ProductName,
       @Semantics.quantity.unitOfMeasure: 'BillingQuantityUnit'
       _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantity,
       @ObjectModel.foreignKey.association: '_BillingQuantityUnit'
       _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit,
       _VBRK_BKPF.BaseUnit,
       @Semantics.amount.currencyCode: 'TransactionCurrency'
       _VBRK_BKPF.NetAmount,

       LIKP.DeliveryDocument,
       LIKP.ShipToParty,
       LIKP._ShipToParty.BPCustomerName                                                                                                                                             as LBPCustomerName,
       LIKP._ShipToParty.TaxNumber3                                                                                                                                                 as LTaxNumber3,
       LIKP._ShipToParty._AddressDefaultRepresentation.CityName                                                                                                                     as LCityName,
       LIKP._ShipToParty._AddressDefaultRepresentation.DistrictName                                                                                                                 as LDistrictName,
       LIKP._ShipToParty._AddressDefaultRepresentation.PostalCode                                                                                                                   as LPostalCode,
       LIKP._ShipToParty._AddressDefaultRepresentation.StreetName                                                                                                                   as LCStreetName,
       LIKP._ShipToParty._AddressDefaultRepresentation.StreetPrefixName1                                                                                                            as LCStreetPrefixName1,
       LIKP._ShipToParty._AddressDefaultRepresentation.StreetPrefixName2                                                                                                            as LCStreetPrefixName2,
       LIKP._ShipToParty._AddressDefaultRepresentation.StreetSuffixName1                                                                                                            as LCStreetSuffixName1,
       t001w.PlantName,
       t001w.AddressID                                                                                                                                                              as PAddressID,
       t001w._StandardOrganizationAddress.AddresseeFullName,
       t001w._StandardOrganizationAddress.StreetName,
       t001w._StandardOrganizationAddress.CityName,
       t001w._StandardOrganizationAddress.DistrictName,
       t001w._StandardOrganizationAddress.PostalCode,
       t001w._StandardOrganizationAddress.StreetPrefixName1,
       t001w._StandardOrganizationAddress.StreetPrefixName2,
       t001w._StandardOrganizationAddress.StreetSuffixName1,
       BBRANCH.IN_GSTIdentificationNumber,
       KNA1.Customer,
       KNA1.BPCustomerName,
       KNA1.AddressID                                                                                                                                                               as CAddressID,
       KNA1.TaxNumber3                                                                                                                                                              as CTaxNumber3,
       KNA1._AddressDefaultRepresentation.CityName                                                                                                                                  as CCityName,
       KNA1._AddressDefaultRepresentation.DistrictName                                                                                                                              as CDistrictName,
       KNA1._AddressDefaultRepresentation.PostalCode                                                                                                                                as CPostalCode,
       KNA1._AddressDefaultRepresentation.StreetName                                                                                                                                as CStreetName,
       KNA1._AddressDefaultRepresentation.StreetPrefixName1                                                                                                                         as CStreetPrefixName1,
       KNA1._AddressDefaultRepresentation.StreetPrefixName2                                                                                                                         as CStreetPrefixName2,
       KNA1._AddressDefaultRepresentation.StreetSuffixName1                                                                                                                         as CStreetSuffixName1,
       t001.CompanyCodeName,
       t001.AddressID                                                                                                                                                               as CCAddressID,
       t001._OrgAddressDefaultRprstn.CityName                                                                                                                                       as CCCityName,
       t001._OrgAddressDefaultRprstn.PostalCode                                                                                                                                     as CCPostalCode,
       t001._OrgAddressDefaultRprstn.StreetName                                                                                                                                     as CCStreetName,
       t001._OrgAddressDefaultRprstn.StreetPrefixName1                                                                                                                              as CCStreetPrefixName1,
       t001._OrgAddressDefaultRprstn.StreetPrefixName2                                                                                                                              as CCStreetPrefixName2,
       t001._OrgAddressDefaultRprstn.StreetSuffixName1                                                                                                                              as CCStreetSuffixName1,
       BBRANCH.IN_GSTIdentificationNumber                                                                                                                                           as CCGSTIN,
       EIDOCTYPE.BillingType,
       EIDOCTYPE.InvoiceType,
       EIDOCTYPE.IrnDocType,
       EIDOCTYPE.SupplyType,
       EIDOCTYPE.IrnApp,
       EIDOCTYPE.EwbApp,
       EIDOCTYPE.EwbDocType,
       EIDOCTYPE.ProcessType,

       _VBRK_BKPF.AccountingExchangeRate *  _VBRK_BKPF.AccountingExchangeRate                                                                                                       as exrate,
       @Semantics.amount.currencyCode: 'TransactionCurrency'
       cast ( cast (  _VBRK_BKPF.NetAmount as abap.dec( 15, 5 ) ) *  _VBRK_BKPF.AccountingExchangeRate as abap.curr(15,2) )                                                         as taxvalue,
       @Semantics.amount.currencyCode: 'TransactionCurrency'
       cast ( cast (  _VBRK_BKPF.NetAmount as abap.dec( 15, 5 ) ) *  _VBRK_BKPF.AccountingExchangeRate / cast( _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantity as abap.dec(13,5) )  as abap.curr(15,2 )) as unitprice,
       marc.ConsumptionTaxCtrlCode,
       case
       when  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'kg'  or  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit  = 'KG'
       then 'KGS'
       when _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'ea'  or  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'EA'
       then 'NOS'
       when  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'pc'  or  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'PC'
         or  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'st'  or  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'ST'
       then 'PCS'
       when  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'dr'  or  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'DR'
       then 'DRM'
       when  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'ft2' or  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'FT2'
       then 'SQF'
       when  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'g'   or  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'G'
       then 'GMS'
       when  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'm2'  or  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'M2'
       then 'SQM'
       when  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'm3'  or  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'M3'
       then 'CBM'
       when  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'ml'  or  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'ML'
       then 'MLT'
       when  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'paa' or  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'PAA'
       then 'PRS'
       else 'OTH'
       end                                                                                                                                                                          as zunit,
       _TransactionCurrency,
       _BillingQuantityUnit
}
where
  _VBRK_BKPF.CreationDate = $parameters.iv_fkdat

 

Thank you,

entry.title: We want to use "Predecessor Journal Entry" in Custom logic
entry.content:
Hello experts,

We know that ACDOCA has "Predecessor Journal Entry".

We want to use the number of "Predecessor Journal Entry" in Custom Logic(BADI).

But I can't find the "Predecessor Journal Entry" in Importing Parameters.

Does SAP S/4 HANA Cloud Public Edition have the way of using "Predecessor Journal Entry" for extension?

entry.title: Extending Standard Timesheet App Using SAPUI5 Adaptation Project in BAS ‚Äì Is
entry.content:
Hello Experts @Andr @ThomasQ @SUPPORT2   ,   

We are using the standard Manage My Timesheet Fiori application in SAP S/4HANA 2023 On-Premise.
Now I have a requirement to extend this standard app using a SAPUI5 Adaptation Project in SAP Business Application Studio (BAS).

 

Requirement

I need to implement custom UI logic so that the Draft mode is automatically enabled whenever the user starts creating or editing a timesheet entry.

Currently, users must manually click the ‚ÄúEnable Draft‚Äù checkbox, which is often missed.

Questions

  1. Is it possible to extend the standard Timesheet app (Manage My Timesheet) using a SAPUI5 Adaptation Project for an on-premise S/4HANA system?

  2. After adapting the UI in BAS, can we deploy the variant back to the on-premise ABAP repository?

  3. Do we need to configure SAP Cloud Connector + BTP Destination for BAS to access the on-premise S/4 system?

  4. Is the controller extension the correct place to implement logic for auto-enabling Draft mode?

  5. Are there any known limitations or best practices when using an adaptation project specifically for the Timesheet application?

    My Understanding (Please Confirm)

    • Adaptation Projects are supported for S/4HANA on-premise if prerequisites (SAP_UI version, UI5 version, no scaffolding app, etc.) are fulfilled.

    • Deployment requires an ABAP package and Transport Request.

    • BAS requires system connectivity through Cloud Connector + Destination using

    • Controller extension should allow injecting custom logic to auto-enable draft mode.

      Request

      Before setting up Cloud Connector and BTP Destinations, I want to confirm whether this approach is the correct and supported way to enhance the Timesheet app, and whether anyone has implemented similar customizations.

      Any guidance, confirmation, or documentation reference would be greatly appreciated.

      Thank you!

      Arbaj Shekh

entry.title: How to use FAC_CDS_UH_GLACCOUNTNODE
entry.content:

Can we use this view in custom query?

How to create the release view by FAC_CDS_UH_GLACCOUNTNODE?

entry.title: How to Configure Local Currency and Thresholds in KPIs for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
entry.content:
Hello everyone,
I‚Äôm currently working on setting up KPIs and reports in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, and I‚Äôve encountered two issues that I haven‚Äôt been able to resolve with the available documentation:

Changing the currency of standard KPIs:
Several KPIs are currently configured with EUR as the default currency. When I try to edit the KPI to switch the currency to our company code currency (COP), the system does not allow me to select another currency.

Is there a way to modify the base currency of these standard KPIs?

Is there something additional that needs to be configured in Manage KPIs and Reports or at the semantic layer (CDS Views / Analytical Queries)?

Setting thresholds and visual limits:
I need to define threshold ranges (optimal, warning, alert) so that these KPIs visually reflect performance levels. However, I haven‚Äôt found a clear place to configure these thresholds.

In which application or section can these KPI thresholds be maintained?

Does this work the same way for both standard and custom KPIs?

Any guidance, best practices, or official documentation references to help address these points would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you in advance for your support!

entry.title: Does it have Chinese version of Journal voucher form template in Public Cloud 2508 version?
entry.content:
Dear Community,

We need to customize a Journal voucher form template in Public cloud 2508 version. For SAP predelivered Template FIN_FO_CORR_INTDOC_ENTRY, there are too many fields needs to be hidden and adjusted.

Does SAP provide a common and simplified template for Chinese users? Which debit amount and credit amount are in different column, and both are with positive figures.

Thanks in advance.

Best Regards,

Grace

entry.title: Redirect navigation to extended ‚ÄúManage Central Purchase Contracts‚Äù app
entry.content:
Hello Experts, good day.

We are facing a peculiar situation and I would like to know if anyone has any ideas on how we could resolve it.

We created an extension of the standard Manage Central Purchase Contracts app. The change was developed in SAP BAS, and the deployment was successful. We also created a target mapping and a tile to use the new extended app. Up to this point, everything works fine, and all tests ran successfully.Target Mapping Inbound Navigation

However, we encountered another issue.

We noticed that a user is working with the Process Purchase Requisitions Centrally app, which includes an option to open the Manage Central Purchase Contracts app. What we need is for this navigation to open our extended app instead of the original standard one.

The problem is that we don‚Äôt know how to achieve this.
Do we need to extend the Process Purchase Requisitions Centrally app as well?
Or is there any way to adjust the target mapping or redirect the navigation without modifying that app?

We are honestly a bit lost on how this could be done, and any guidance would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks
EBZ

SAP Analytics Cloud, hybrid analytics  SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Extensibility SAP BTP ABAP environment

entry.title: How to Calculate VAT for PO and get in the Standard form(MM_PUR_PURCHASE_ORDER)
entry.content: Hello experts, I‚Äôm using the PO form template MM_PUR_PURCHASE_ORDER. I need to calculate VAT at line item level, sum it up, and show the final amount including VAT in the PO PDF. I understand VAT fields exist in PO item conditions, but they are not exposed in the delivered template. Could you guide me on how to expose these fields via CDS/OData and bind them in the form template, including the calculation logic for summation? Thanks in advance!

entry.title: ABAP Runtime error when adding WBS element to the Sales Order
entry.content:
Hi Everyone,

I‚Äôm working in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud and I‚Äôm trying to create a sales order using the standard ‚ÄúManage Sales Orders‚Äù app.

The error only happens when I add a WBS Element to the sales order item. As soon as I enter the WBS element and press Enter or try to save, I get the following error popup:

  • ABAP Runtime error 'MESSAGE_TYPE_X'

  • Unspecified provider error occurred. See Error Context and Call Stack.

  • Resource not found for entity 'C_SALESORDERMANAGE'

( Screenshot attached)

Has anyone seen this issue before in Public Cloud?
Is this related to a missing configuration, a restriction in the public cloud scope, or possibly a backend issue requiring SAP support? What should I check in the system?

Any guidance or hints on where to check would be greatly appreciated.

entry.title: In public cloud how to get Sales Order Header Text
entry.content:
How can we read Sales Order Header Text in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud (clean core, no modification)?

I have tried multiple ways but couldn‚Äôt get the header text of a Sales Order.
In Public Cloud:

  • Read_Text is not allowed

  • Table access to STXH/STXL is not allowed

  • CDS view extensibility for reading text via text-object/text-id is not available

  • BAdI access to SD text API is restricted

  • The only relevant released view is I_SALESORDERTP , but this cannot be used inside our custom CDS view.

entry.title: S/4HANA cloud public data migration practice test
entry.content:
Hello,

1. I am having issues with s/4hana cloud public practice test, exercise 9, data migration. I successfully downloaded and populated the .xml file with the data provided in the guided pdf doc and saved as .xml but I cant seem to validate, it keeps saying validation failed with error "

The format of the uploaded file Source data for Bank_092.xml is wrong. The file contains only one line" I am sure my file has 3 lines as instructed in the pdf file. I have deleted and redownloaded several times. I have been on this for over 3 days now. Can someone help me? As I need to schedule my exam but I cant do that without completing the practice test. I have attached images of my .xml file and error messages and text of error messages. I cant proceed to exercise 10 without completing exercise 9.

ERROR:

Long Description

Short Text

The format of the uploaded file Source data for Bank_092.xml is wrong

Diagnosis

The format of the uploaded file Source data for Bank_092.xml is wrong. The file contains only one line.

Procedure

Check the file and correct the format.

 

 

2. I cant seem to start exercise 11 too "Copy and Edit a Standard Test Automate Process". I cant find the "Manage Your Test Processes App" as well under my practice test. Is exercise 9 a prerequisite for exercises 11 to 13 or why cant I find Manage Your Test Processes App? 

Please I need help as I have tried all means. Exercises 9 to 13 I am stucked! I cant schedule my exams without completing the practice test!

I am tired and frustrated its over 3 days now!!!

entry.title: S/4HANA Cloud Public - Executing SOAP API upon Sales Order Creation (Before Save Logic)
entry.content:
Dear SAP Community,

We are seeking guidance on the best practice for implementing a custom action triggered during the Sales Order creation process in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.

Core Requirement

We need to implement a Before Save action (similar to a Pre-Exit logic) during the creation of a Sales Order (SO) by the Key User. The goal is that, once the Sales Order is successfully created in the system, the external SOAP API: https://api.sap.com/api/SERVICECONTRACTREQUEST_IN must be consumed and executed immediately.

 

Specific Technical Questions

1. Internal API Consumption via ABAP Environment (ADT)

Internal Consumption via ADT: Is it possible to consume this specific SOAP API directly within the ABAP Environment (ADT) using Developer Extensibility options (e.g., via EML (Entity Manipulation Language) or an internal release)? Or is this API strictly intended for external consumption (side-by-side extensibility via RAP, Java, or JavaScript)?

  • If internal consumption is possible, what is the recommended BAdI (Business Add-In) in the Sales Order flow that executes after all consistency checks but before the final commit to ensure API execution aligns with the SO creation?

 

2. Locking Behavior & Concurrency

Locking Behavior: If a Key User currently has the specific Sales Order open and is actively using it within the UI, will the API request fail due to a locking conflict if the API attempts to create a follow-up document?

  • In systems like SAP Business ByDesign, concurrent editing is strictly disallowed. We would like to confirm if S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition behaves similarly, and what implications this has for external API calls triggered by the Key User's save action.

Thank you for your insights and recommendations.
